resources.string: The National Council on Disability Affairs (NCDA) is the Philippine government\'s policy-making, coordinating, and monitoring body for disability issues.\n It aims to promote the rights and well-being of persons with disabilities in the Philippines.\n You can find more information on the official website: https://ncda.gov.ph/.
To provide direction to all stakeholders through policy formulation, coordination, monitoring, and evaluation of all activities to “MAKE THE RIGHTS REAL” for all.
All persons with disabilities are able to attain their fullest potential and to become active contributors and participants in nation-building.

Community: A value that helps the NCDA be culturally unifying.
 Professionalism: A value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.
 Diversity and inclusion: A value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.
 Competency: A value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.
 Integrity: A value that helps the NCDA uphold honesty and ethical behavior.
 Inspiration: A value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.
 Innovation: An aspirational value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.
 Accountability: An aspirational value that helps the NCDA fulfill its mission.

Policy development: The NCDA creates policies on disability prevention, rehabilitation, and equal opportunities for people with disabilities.
 Advocacy: The NCDA advocates for the rights of people with disabilities and proposes legislation.
 Public information: The NCDA develops public information programs on disability prevention, rehabilitation, and equal opportunities.
 Credentialing: The NCDA offers competency-based credentials for people in the field of career development.
 Program evaluation: The NCDA evaluates and monitors programs related to disability prevention and rehabilitation.
Latest PWD-related news will be displayed here.
